summary: An email from Mark Hull to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, offering assistance in the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. Hull claims that Hollywood figures, including Natalie Portman, Reese Witherspoon, and former Disney CEO Bob Iger, attempted to help Maxwell locate him, and suggests subpoenaing his phone records for evidence. He also requests the FBI reopen an investigation into Disney.

persons.name: Mark Hull
persons.context: Author of the email who claims to have worked briefly with MSNBC and New York Times on the Harvey Weinstein investigation. He offers to assist the DOJ, alleges Hollywood figures tried to help Maxwell find him, and requests a review of a prior Disney financial investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. The correspondent states she was arrested and believes her to be guilty, but suggests she is not the 'true prize' and that others are involved.

persons.name: Natalie Portman
persons.context: Allegedly attempted, along with Reese Witherspoon, to assist Ghislaine Maxwell in finding the email's author, Mark Hull.

persons.name: Reese Witherspoon
persons.context: Allegedly attempted, along with Natalie Portman, to assist Ghislaine Maxwell in finding the email's author, Mark Hull.

persons.name: Bob Iger
persons.role: Former CEO of The Walt Disney Company
persons.context: Allegedly tried with 'greater zeal' to help Ghislaine Maxwell find Mark Hull, including hiring a private investigator. The author questions his motives.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of an investigation the author, Mark Hull, previously worked on with reporters.

connections.description: Hull is offering information to the DOJ to assist in the case against Maxwell, whom he believes is guilty.
Hull alleges Portman attempted to assist Maxwell in finding him, suggesting some form of association.
Hull alleges Witherspoon attempted to assist Maxwell in finding him, suggesting some form of association.
Hull alleges Iger tried with 'greater zeal' to help Maxwell find him, including hiring a private investigator.
Hull questions Iger's motives for trying to find him and requests the FBI reopen an investigation into Disney's financial practices.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell by authorities, which the email author references as a recent action he is happy about.

events.title: Hollywood Figures Attempt to Locate Mark Hull
events.description: Alleged attempts by Natalie Portman, Reese Witherspoon, and Bob Iger to assist Ghislaine Maxwell in finding the email's author, Mark Hull.

events.title: Prior Investigation into Disney
events.description: Mark Hull references a prior FBI investigation into the Walt Disney Company concerning theft from a dividend reinvestment program, which he claims was not thorough and should be reopened.

locations: New York, NY (referenced as location of US Attorney's Office)
Burbank, California (referenced as location of Disney conference rooms where calls allegedly originated)
keyFacts: Mark Hull alleges that Hollywood figures Natalie Portman, Reese Witherspoon, and former Disney CEO Bob Iger attempted to help Ghislaine Maxwell locate him.
Hull suggests subpoenaing his Verizon Wireless phone records from a specific number to find evidence of calls from individuals involved, potentially from Disney conference rooms in Burbank, CA.
Hull states he has no necessarily new information on Epstein or Maxwell but offers to help the DOJ 'connect the dots'.
Hull requests the FBI reopen an investigation into the Walt Disney Company regarding alleged theft from a dividend reinvestment program.
The email frames Maxwell's arrest as a step, but not the 'true prize', implying a wider network of involved individuals.
